research_goal.title: Novel Epigenetic Targets for Pulmonary Fibrosis
research_goal.description: Propose novel epigenetic regulators (histone modifiers, chromatin remodelers, DNA methyltransferases) that could serve as therapeutic targets for pulmonary fibrosis. Focus on mechanisms controlling myofibroblast differentiation and fibrogenesis. Hypotheses should integrate recent epigenetic discoveries with fibrosis pathobiology.
constraints: Should be testable in cell/organoid systems
Consider existing epigenetic drugs as templates

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 1 (Literature-based): Biomedicine/Pulmonology Mechanism
hypotheses.description: Generated from synthesizing literature on Biomedicine/Pulmonology. This hypothesis proposes a novel mechanism integrating existing research.
hypotheses.mechanism: Building on current understanding of Biomedicine/Pulmonology, this mechanism suggests that the key pathway involves cross-disciplinary integration of molecular and systems-level effects.
testable_predictions: Prediction 1: Observable effect in Biomedicine/Pulmonology context
grounding_evidence: Wang et al. (2023) - Supporting pathway analysis
